thread.title: Ronaldo, Messi Among Ballon D'Or Nominees
thread.title_full: Ronaldo, Messi Among Ballon D'Or Nominees

title: Ronaldo, Messi Among Ballon D'Or Nominees
text:
Ronaldo, Messi Among Ballon D'Or Nominees 07:26, UK, Tuesday 20 October 2015 Share by email Cristiano Ronaldo, Lionel Messi and Neymar are among the 23 nominees named by FIFA for this year's Ballon d'Or award. 
The list of players will be cut down to three final contenders on 30 November, with Barcelona's Argentine forward Messi and Real Madrid's Portuguese striker Ronaldo almost certain to make the cut. 
With Messi out for up to eight weeks with an ankle injury, Brazil striker Neymar has taken over the spotlight at Barcelona and is looking to prove he has what it takes to finally make the three-player shortlist, having been on the 23-man list five times in a row. 
Messi and Ronaldo have shared the Ballon d'Or between themselves since 2008, with Messi claiming four and Ronaldo three, including the 2013 and 2014 awards. 
Chelsea manager Jose Mourinho, who was last week fined Â£50,000 and given a suspended one-match stadium ban by the FA, is on the list of 10 nominees for World Coach of the Year. 
Mourinho was sanctioned for remarks that "constituted improper conduct" as they implied bias and brought the game into disrepute after he accused referees of being prejudiced against his team. 
The winners of Ballon d'Or and Coach of the Year will be announced on 11 January, having been chosen by a vote of international managers, captains and football journalists.
